entry.title: U.S.-brokered Abraham Accords could include Armenia and Azerbaijan

media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry did not rule out joining regional peace efforts like the Abraham Accords, following remarks from a U.S. representative that Armenia and Azerbaijan might join. üìç Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan met with EU official Kaja Kallas to reaffirm democratic ties and discuss regional peace amid criticism of recent EU-Azerbaijan diplomacy. üìç An employee of the Armenian National Archive has been charged with spying for Azerbaijan. entry.title: Why Netanyahu‚Äôs Baku visit was scrapped

media:group.media:title: Why Netanyahu‚Äôs Baku visit was scrapped
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian covers three key developments shaping Armenia's regional and domestic landscape. He begins with the cancelled summit between Israeli and Turkish officials in Baku, examining the deeper strategic divide over the future of Syria, and how it could create opportunities for Armenia. Hacopian also argues why Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs decision to attend the May 9th Victory Day parade in Moscow despite calls from Europe for a boycott is a symbolic move that makes strategic sense for Armenia. Finally, he covers the expansion of additional Wizz Air flights from Europe to Armenia, calling it a welcome step forward while the government lacks a long-term tourism strategy.
